intro: Crepis kurdistanica, commonly known as Kurdish mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has hairy leaves and produces small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Crepis kurdistanica is often found in alpine and steppe habitats, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
